author: Chandra Philip
description: The B.C. government says it is making changes to how home builders pay for new housing projects, in an effort to spur more development. The changes announced include reducing upfront development costs, and a more flexible timeline for builders to pay. Minister of Housing and Municipal Affairs Ravi Kahlon told reporters the government was committed […]
title: BC Changes Cost Regulations for Home Builders to Increase Construction

author: Nadeem Esmail
description: Commentary While running for the job of leading the country, Prime Minister Mark Carney promised to defend the Canada Health Act (CHA) and build a health-care system Canadians can be proud of. Unfortunately, to have any hope of accomplishing the latter promise, he must break the former and reform the CHA. As long as Ottawa […]
title: Carney Can Make Good on Campaign Promise by Reforming the Canada Health Act

author: Chandra Philip
description: Revenue and spending for local governments have increased faster than inflation and population growth, reaching near record levels, according to a new study. The study, Expanding Finances of Local Governments in Canada, examined municipal revenues and expenditures over a more than 30-year-period, from 1990 to 2023. It was published by public policy research organization the […]
title: Local Government Spending Growing Faster Than Inflation and Population Growth in Canada: Study

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Narendra Modi Visits Ghana, SpaceX to Build Antennas in Switzerland, and Yellow-Eyed Penguins

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The federal government has issued draft legislation ensuring all Canada Carbon Rebates for small businesses are given tax-free, meeting a promise previously given by the former finance minister. Finance Minister François-Philippe Champagne introduced draft legislation on June 30 that would ensure payments received by corporations related to the fuel charge from 2019 to 2023 would […]
title: Ottawa to Make Carbon Rebates for Small Businesses Non-Taxable

author: Lily Zhou
description: The Tibetan spiritual leader has told followers that 'no one else has any such authority to interfere.'
title: Dalai Lama Confirms Plans for a Successor, Defying Beijing

author: Matthew Horwood
description: News Analysis The federal government has made electric vehicles (EV) a priority over the last few years, with sizable investments in battery factories, a rebate program to improve affordability, and a mandate to phase out the purchase of new gas-powered vehicles by 2035. But with the U.S. government signing resolutions blocking a similar EV mandate […]
title: How Trump’s EV Move in US Could Impact Canada’s Mandates

author: Olivia Gomm
description: A southern district in B.C. has declared a state of local emergency and issued evacuation orders due to rapidly spreading wildfires near Lytton, a village devastated by a similar blaze in 2021. The Thompson-Nicola Regional District issued evacuation orders in the Blue Sky Country region because of the “immediate danger to life safety” caused by […]
title: State of Local Emergency, Evacuation Orders Near Lytton, BC, Due to Wildfires

author: Alex Wu
description: India doesn’t want to take a clear stance between the two major world powers—China and the United States—said an analyst.
title: CCP’s Influence Further Wanes as India Rejects Shanghai Cooperation Organization Statement

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Alberta’s new lower bar for referendums is set to go into effect July 4 as anti-separatist petitioners led by former Deputy Premier Thomas Lukaszuk seek to beat the separatist movement to a referendum question. The changes making it easier for Albertans to hold a referendum were introduced April 29 by Alberta Premier Danielle Smith. Though […]
title: Alberta’s New Referendum Rules Launch July 4 as Anti-Separatists Seek to Counter Independence Push

author: The Canadian Press
description: Victoria Mayor Marianne Alto says residents will see a difference in community safety within six months after announcing $10.35 million in funding for additional police and bylaw officers, temporary housing and the “huge task” of cleaning up parts of the city. Alto’s announcement comes after the city released a Community Safety and Wellbeing Plan last […]
title: Victoria Mayor Announces $10 Million on Diverted Spending for Community Safety

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: Meat and Livestock Australia says it now realises the difficulties of committing to net zero by 2030.
title: Meat Industry Body Retreats From Net Zero by 2030 Target

author: Chandra Philip
description: Saskatchewan is backing Alberta as the two western provinces seek to oppose the federal Impact Assessment Act in court. The province says it is “intervening” to support Alberta’s legal action aimed at challenging the act that governs approval of major initiatives such as energy projects, power plants, and mines. Justice Minister Tim McLeod said Saskatchewan’s […]
title: Saskatchewan Joins Alberta’s Legal Challenge Over Ottawa’s Impact Assessment Act

author: Frank Fang
description: ‘This sanction is a badge of honor,’ Francis Tolentino said.
title: China Sanctions Former Filipino Lawmaker Over South China Sea Dispute

author: Owen Evans
description: The European Union’s Digital Services Act requires online platforms such as Google and Meta to combat disinformation and demonstrate compliance.
title: EU’s Big Tech Disinformation Law Comes Into Force

author: Jack Phillips
description: The nation has limited IAEA inspections of its facilities in the past during negotiations over its nuclear program.
title: Iran Formally Suspends Cooperation With UN Nuclear Watchdog

author: Guy Birchall
description: The presidents of France and Russia talked for more than two hours.
title: Macron, Putin Hold First Phone Call Since 2022

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Alberta is launching an action team this summer to address increasing aggression and complex needs in classrooms, the province’s education minister has announced. The Aggression and Complexity in Schools Action Team will be composed of teachers and education partners who will provide Alberta with recommendations on short- and long-term actions to support both students and […]
title: Alberta Creates Action Team to Address Aggression, Complexity in Classrooms

author: Michael Wing
description: Late in the evening, Kai Haase knows to watch for them. The dancing green lights will first appear faint, but they come alive after dark. Though this night in early May was cloudier that most, Haase had  managed to snap the first vestiges of northern lights on the horizon with her phone. By midnight, they’re […]
title: Alberta Aurora Chaser Captures Red and Green Showstopper Right Above Her Head

author: Aldgra Fredly
description: At least 332 people have been arrested for offenses related to national security since the draconian law was enacted in Hong Kong.
title: US Lawmaker, EU Decry Repression of Dissent on 5-Year Mark of Hong Kong National Security Law

author: The Canadian Press
description: The Canada Revenue Agency says taxpayers who already paid the now-defunct digital services tax will have to wait for Ottawa to pass new legislation before they can get their refund. Prime Minister Mark Carney announced late Sunday that, in a bid to restart trade negotiations with the United States, Canada was dropping the tax on […]
title: Ottawa Must Pass a Law Revoking Digital Service Tax Before Refunds Are Issued: CRA

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Six suspects have been arrested and others may be at large following an armed home invasion that led to the closure of a major highway in Ontario’s cottage country on Canada Day, provincial police say. Officers were called to a home in the Hillside East area near Huntsville, Ont., the morning of July 1 after […]
title: Police Nab 6 Suspects After Armed Home Invasion in Ontario’s Cottage Country, Others May Be At Large

author: The Canadian Press
description: Sobeys parent company Empire Co. Ltd. has officially signed on as the first retailer member of Canada’s new grocery code of conduct, as work continues to develop governance rules for members ahead of a full implementation by Jan. 1. The Office of the Grocery Sector Code of Conduct says dairy product-maker Lactalis Canada has also […]
title: Empire, Lactalis Canada Become First to Officially Sign on to Grocery Code of Conduct

author: Guy Birchall
description: British Energy Minister Ed Miliband called the findings of the report into the March incident 'deeply concerning.'
title: Fire That Led to Heathrow Airport Shutdown Caused by Poor Maintenance: Report

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: One of the two men convicted last year for mischief and weapon possession during the Coutts, Alta., border blockade has been granted bail as he appeals his conviction and six-and-a-half year sentence. Alberta appeal court Justice Jo’Anne Strekaf granted Chris Carbert’s release in a June 30 ruling. She noted that “despite the serious nature of […]
title: Jailed Coutts COVID Protester Receives Bail Pending Appeal of Mischief, Weapons Charges

author: Andrew Moran
description: The latest announcement was made a week before the White House's July 9 deadline.
title: Trump Announces US–Vietnam Trade Agreement

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The current model of international student migration is not working, a new report suggests.
title: International Student Migration a ‘Backdoor’ for Migration, Think Tank Warns

author: Adam Morrow
description: For the past 40 years, the Kurdistan Workers Party has waged a violent insurgency against the Turkish state.
title: Kurdish PKK May Disarm Within Days After Decades of Violence, Turkey’s AK Party Says

description: Abbas Araghchi said, 'One cannot obliterate technology and science through bombardment.'
title: Iranian Foreign Minister Says Fordow Nuclear Site ‘Heavily Damaged’

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: An Australian arts body said it made a mistake in initially banning an artistic duo from attending a global art exhibition.
title: Backflip: Creative Australia Reinstates Artists Behind Hezbollah, Bin Laden Imagery

description: The rapper drew the attention of the minister's office after the release of a song titled 'Heil Hitler.'

description: 'Hydrogen is just too hard at the moment. Until the prices come down, I don't think we'll see those projects taking off the ground,' said Annastacia Palaszczuk.

description: The police are yet to comment on this new case.

description: The Quad foreign ministers raised concerns over the risks of relying on a single country for processing and refining critical minerals.

author: Dorothy Li
description: During Xi's decade-plus tenure, he centralized decision-making power through various CCP groups. Now, the Politburo is reviewing measures to regulate them.

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: The Yoorrook Justice Commission heard from more than 200 witnesses over the past 4 years and has made 100 recommendations for urgent change.
title: Aboriginal Victorians Were Victims of Genocide, Commission Finds

author: The Canadian Press
description: A dual Canadian-American citizen that United States authorities allege was part of a deadly human smuggling operation that left migrants drowned in the St. Lawrence River will remain in custody following a detention hearing in the Northern District of New York District Court on Tuesday. The U.S. Justice Department said 34-year-old Timothy Oakes was arrested […]
title: Canada-US Citizen in Custody in Deadly St. Lawrence River Human Smuggling Case

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: A 30-year-old Bundaberg man has been charged with two counts of accessory after the fact to murder.
title: Third Person Charged for Involvement in Murder of Queensland Teen Pheobe

author: Alfred Bui
description: This comes as U.S. President Donald Trump’s deadline for tariff negotiations is approaching.
